text: Ángela Álvarez (June 13, 1927 – December 6, 2024) was a Cuban-born American singer. She was known as the oldest Latin Grammy Award for Best New Artist winner ever. She shared the 2022 award in 2022. Her songs were first recorded on an album produced by her grandson, Carlos José Alvarez. Alvarez was in the 2022 remake of Father of the Bride, where she sang "Quiéreme mucho". She was born in Camagüey, Cuba. Alvarez died on December 6, 2024 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana at the age of 97. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1927 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Latin Grammy Award winners Category:Cuban entertainers Category:Singers from Baton Rouge, Louisiana
title: Ángela Álvarez
